description.text:
IOA YANG definitions for for all data plane services supported by a typical Layer 1 transponder that enable traffic.
The services enable digital client traffic (such as Ethernet, SONET/SDH, ...) to be transported through the transponder.
Other services types include OTN services (switching, transport, multiplexing).
The transport of native services could include OTN framing, or could bypass/skip OTN layer,
depending upon the capability of the hardware.
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R6.0
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.2
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.0
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R4.0
To be used where mapping is not applicable
OTUCn protocol layer.
Infinera proprietary OTUCni protocol layer.
Infinera proprietary OTUCni protocol layer.
ODU4 protocol layer.
Infinera proprietary ODU4i protocol layer.
Infinera proprietary ODUflexi protocol layer.
ODU-flex protocol layer.
ODU0 protocol layer.
ODU1 protocol layer.
ODU2 protocol layer.
ODU2e protocol layer.
AMP mapping
BMP mapping
Network mapping extra values.
A custom data type that can be used for configuring optical Tx/Rx power attributes.
Services of multiples types commissioned in this NE.

Layer 1 digital services that are currently provisioned in the system.
This includes pre-provisoned XCONs too.
A user configured name for the XCON.
The source end-point between which the XCON needs to be created.
The destination end-point between which the XCON needs to be created.

Time-slots allocated to the source lo-oduj in this xcon. Not applicable if source facility is not an ODU facility.
Note: parameter is deprecated - will stop being supported in a future release.

Time-slots allocated to the destination lo-oduj in this xcon. Not applicable if destination facility is not an ODU facility.
Note: parameter is deprecated - will stop being supported in a future release.
Describes whether this xcon was system created or not. Only user created xcon can be user deleted.
payload-treatment for ethernet ctp xcon.
payload-treatment for client otu4 and line odu4 xcon when PT is OTU4.
payload-treatment for client odu4 and line odu4 xcon when PT is 100G.
payload-treatment for two line lo-odu4 xcon when PT is OTU4.
payload-treatment for two line lo-odu4 xcon when PT is 100G.
Indicates a generic payload treatment value of the digital XCON.
Indicates the server layer protocol type that supports this XCON.
Type of XCON.
Represents the protection type this XCON has.
Indicate server layer adaptation at client side.
Indicate server layer adaptation at line side.
List of resources being used by this XCON besides the two main source/destination end-points.
Only of relevance for OADM NEs with Layer 0 support.
List of Optical Cross Connections (OXcon).
A user configured name for the OXcon.
The source end-point required for OXcon creation.
The destination end-point required for OXcon creation.
Two-way indicates the OXcon is bi-directional.
One-way indicates the OXcon is uni-directional
Set-by-create OXcon type.
Only of relevance for power working mode and two-way OXcon.
The source interface target power.
The destination interface target power.

Value: as calculated by Power Control if target-power-setting = auto;
otherwise it is the exact value configured at target-output-power-dst/ src.

Value: as calculated by Power Control if target-power-setting = auto;
otherwise it is the exact value configured at target-output-power-dst/ src.
Actual PSD destination
Actual PSD source
A generic payload type for all 100GBASE-X Ethernet clients when provisioning a digital XCON.
A generic payload type for all 400GBASE-X Ethernet clients when provisioning a digital XCON.
A generic payload type for OTU4 Transport w/o FEC service.
A generic payload type for ODU4 switching services.
A generic payload type for ODU2 switching services.
A generic payload type for ODU2e switching services.
Not applicable for 2-step XCON approach.
Indicates a generic, high-level source (from) client payload type of the digital XCON.
Indicates whether the digital XCON is uni-directional (1-WAY) or bi-directional (2-WAY).
User configured circuit ID suffix.
Command for automatic creation of xcon and associated facilities.
To be used in case this end point refers to an existing facility.

Source end-point of the xcon. Must be an existing facility that can be used
as a XCON end-point.

To be used in case this end point needs to be automatically created implicitly.
Applies to the automatic creation of low order ODUs for XCON end-points.
Name of the High Order parent ODU where to audst-create this ODU end-point.

List of time-slots to allocate to the automatically created LO-ODU.
Value can be:
- omitted/empty - in which case system will audst-allocate time-slots based on the src-instance-id,
                  which becomes mandatory (this is only supported for non ODUflex scenarios.)
- starting time-slot - system automatically allocates the rest of the time-slots sequentially
                       from this starting point; will fail if those time-slots are not available
- time-slot list - full list of time-slots, using a comma separated list, with 'x..y' representing
                   ranges; the total number of time-slots need to match the associated payload-type
                   (e.g. 80 time-slots for 100G payload, 320 time-slots for 400G payload, etc)

Optional parameter on LO-ODU creation, identifies the ODU within the parent/high-order ODU.
If not provided, it is automatically derived.
Max value depends on capacity of the HO-ODU and of the odu-type.
(ex: for creating an ODU4 in a HO ODUC8, instance can be between 1 and 8)
Note: instance-id becomes mandatory if time-slots are not provided.
To be used in case this end point refers to an existing facility.

Destination end-point of the xcon. Must be an existing facility that can be used
as a XCON end-point.

To be used in case this end point needs to be automatically created implicitly.
Applies to the automatic creation of low order ODUs for XCON end-points.
Name of the High Order parent ODU where to audst-create this ODU end-point.

List of time-slots to allocate to the automatically created LO-ODU.
Value can be:
- omitted/empty - in which case system will audst-allocate time-slots based on the dst-instance-id,
                  which becomes mandatory (this is only supported for non ODUflex scenarios.)
- starting time-slot - system automatically allocates the rest of the time-slots sequentially
                       from this starting point; will fail if those time-slots are not available
- time-slot list - full list of time-slots, using a comma separated list, with 'x..y' representing
                   ranges; the total number of time-slots need to match the associated payload-type
                   (e.g. 80 time-slots for 100G payload, 320 time-slots for 400G payload, etc)

Optional parameter on LO-ODU creation, identifies the ODU within the parent/high-order ODU.
If not provided, it is automatically derived.
Max value depends on capacity of the HO-ODU and of the odu-type.
(ex: for creating an ODU4 in a HO ODUC8, instance can be between 1 and 8)
Note: instance-id becomes mandatory if time-slots are not provided.
